meanings.sent1: The overage amount of candy made the children very happy.
meanings.sent2: The store had to discount the overage inventory to make room for new stock.
meanings.sent3: The overage number of balloons at the party caused the room to look like a colorful cloud.

meanings.definition: The condition of being too old for something.
meanings.sent1: His overage in years made him ineligible for the youth soccer league.
meanings.sent2: The overage of the car meant it was time to start looking for a new one.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's overage in technology made her struggle with using the new smartphone.
meanings.sent4: The overage of the building gave it a historic charm that attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent5: The overage of the tree made it a favorite spot for birds to build their nests.
